body: Education  Fort Raleigh National Historic Site is a great place for students to explore a variety of subjects, from the history of the Lost Colony to the role this area played in the Civil War.    Explore the park during a class field trip, on your own, or with a park ranger. If your school is unable to visit Fort Raleigh, find some suggested readings to help spice up your lessons.                   Every Kid in a Park Fourth-graders and their families can discover federal lands—national parks, wildlife refuges, national forests, and more—for free!
